the posts are usually made of wood or metal
the rails are usually made of wood or metal
shipwreck: broken pieces of wood or metal
visible damage to the hull or superstructure
debris or wreckage scattered around the area
sailboat: a mast with a sail attached
a rudder and tiller for steering
a boom to control the angle of the sail
a deck with seating and storage areas
yurt: a smoke hole at the top of the roof
a wooden frame or lattice structure
comic book: a spine with the title of the comic book
pages with comic book panels and text
crossword: a list of words to be filled in
traffic or street sign: a bright color, such as red, yellow, or orange
a symbol or text indicating the purpose of the sign
a post or pole to support the sign
traffic light: a box at the top of the pole with three lights (red, yellow, and green)
a button or lever to control the lights
a sign or symbol indicating the purpose of the light
a base or foundation to support the pole
dust jacket: a flap or fold-over at the front or back
a spine with text or artwork
a back cover with text or artwork
menu: a logo or name of the restaurant
a layout with sections for different types of food
a design or theme that reflects the restaurant's style
plate: usually made of ceramic, plastic, or metal
may have a design or pattern on it
consomme: a thin layer of fat on the surface
trifle: a variety of ingredients such as sponge cake, custard, jelly, fruit, and cream
a topping of whipped cream, nuts, or chocolate
a decorative garnish such as a sprig of mint or a sprinkle of cocoa powder
ice cream: a variety of colors and flavors
a waffle cone or sugar cone
popsicle: a wooden stick or plastic handle
a variety of colors and flavors
baguette: visible air pockets in the crust
a slight sheen of oil on the crust
bagel: variety of toppings, such as sesame seeds, poppy seeds, or onion flakes
cheeseburger: lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, and other toppings
condiments such as ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise
hot dog: condiments such as ketchup, mustard, relish, onions, etc.
cabbage: white veins running through the leaves
acorn squash: dark green skin with light green stripes
a blossom end at the bottom
butternut squash: ridges running along the length of the squash
a green stem at the top
cucumber: ridges running along the length of the cucumber
bell pepper: a stem and calyx at the top
cardoon: a cluster of small, edible seeds at the base of the stem
mushroom: gills or pores on the underside of the cap
a ring or skirt around the stem
a cup or volva at the base of the stem
a spore print on the underside of the cap
strawberry: small, green leaves at the top
fig: yellow, green, or purple in color
pineapple: a crown of leaves at the top
banana: curved stem at the other end
hay: a tendency to form clumps or bales
carbonara: cooked pasta such as spaghetti or fettuccine
chocolate syrup: drizzling or pouring from a container
dough: ability to hold its shape when molded
meatloaf: a mixture of ground meat, eggs, breadcrumbs, and seasonings
a glaze or sauce on top

sauce such as tomato or pesto
herbs and spices such as oregano or basil

a golden-brown color on the crust
a flaky texture on the crust
burrito: a variety of fillings, such as beans, rice, meat, and vegetables
a variety of sauces, such as salsa, guacamole, and sour cream
a variety of toppings, such as cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes
a folded shape with ends tucked in
red wine: label with the name of the wine
sediment at the bottom of the bottle
espresso: a layer of foam on top
tea cup: lid to keep the tea warm
eggnog: cinnamon sticks or other spices added for flavor
bubble: a thin layer of air inside
cliff: vegetation growing on the cliff face
geyser: a plume of steam or water vapor rising from the surface
a cone-shaped mound of rock or sediment around the vent
a pool of hot water at the base of the geyser
a series of terraces or ledges around the vent
lakeshore: shoreline with rocks, sand, or vegetation
reflections of the sky and clouds on the water
promontory: a wide view of the surrounding area
a lighthouse or other structure at the top of the promontory

a line of foam or bubbles along the edge of the sandbar
a line of debris or seaweed along the edge of the sandbar
a line of shells or rocks along the edge of the sandbar
beach: boats or other watercraft in the distance
valley: a river or stream running through the valley
volcano: steam or smoke rising from the crater
a caldera or other volcanic features

corn: tassels at the top of the husk
a cob with rows of kernels
a pointed tip at the end of the cob
acorn: cap or cup-like structure at the top
horse chestnut seed: light-colored, star-shaped mark on one side
small, white, fluffy tuft at one end
coral fungus: growing on dead wood or soil
agaric: gills or pores on the underside of the cap
stem that is usually white or light-colored
cap that is usually convex or flat
ring or annulus around the stem
gyromitra: foul odor when cut or bruised

a distinctive shape, often resembling a phallus

a spore sac in the center
a white, powdery spore dust on the surface
